docs.summary: The wix-site-frontend module contains functionality for obtaining information about a site and its pages.
description: To use the site module, import `wixSiteFrontend` from the `wix-site-frontend` module:
```javascript
import wixSiteFrontend from 'wix-site-frontend';
The APIs in `wix-site-frontend` can only be used in frontend code.

docs.summary: Retrieves a code representing the site's currency.
description: The retrieved currency code corresponds to the currency that has been
entered in the General Info section of a site's [dashboard](https://support.wix.com/en/article/about-your-wix-dashboard).
The currency is used by a site with apps, for example Wix Stores or Wix Bookings, and other
Wix features.

docs.summary: Retrieves information about a current page or lightbox.

examples.title: Get information about the current page
Get information about the current lightbox

docs.summary: Retrieves a code representing the site's language.
description: The retrieved language code corresponds to the main site language
as found in the General Info section of a site's [dashboard](https://support.wix.com/en/article/about-your-wix-dashboard).
> **Note:** If you have a multilingual site, and it's being viewed in a language
that's not the main site language, the `language` property still returns
the main site language. To work with the languages of a multilingual site,
use the Multilingual API.

docs.summary: Retrieves a site's regional settings.
description: The retrieved regional settings corresponds to the regional settings
that has been entered in the General Info section of a site's [dashboard](https://support.wix.com/en/article/about-your-wix-dashboard).
The regional settings are used to determine how numbers, dates, and currencies
are displayed on a site.

docs.summary: Retrieves the site revision ID.
description: The site revision ID is a unique identifier for the current revision of
a site. Each time a site is manually saved or published
following a change, a new revision is created.
You can view and manage a site's revisions in the [Site History](https://support.wix.com/en/article/viewing-and-managing-your-site-history).
You can use [site monitoring](https://support.wix.com/en/article/about-site-monitoring#site-revisions) to
monitor and debug new revisions of a site.
> **Notes:**
> + Since publishing a site may change the revision ID, the ID when
>   previewing a site may be different than the ID for the published site.
> + The site revision ID is unique, but not meaningful.
>   Therefore, you can't predict future revision IDs before they're created.

docs.summary: Retrieves a site's time zone.
description: The retrieved time zone is the time zone that has been
entered in the General Info section of a site's [dashboard](https://support.wix.com/en/article/about-your-wix-dashboard).
The time zone is used by a site with apps, for example Wix Stores or Wix Bookings, and other
Wix features.

params.name: fonts
params.doc: List of fonts to be loaded, where each font is represented by a value of a `font` CSS property.

params.name: options
params.doc: The options used when getting the HTML element.

ret.doc: Fulfilled - HTML element containing the CSS code that loads the fonts.

docs.summary: Gets an HTML element containing CSS code to load fonts.
description: Use `getFontsHtml()` to get an HTML element containing the CSS code that loads 1 or more fonts.
Use `getFontsHtml()` when embedding a custom element in a Wix site where the page's stylesheet fonts
are inaccessible, such as when using a shadow root or an internal iframe.

docs.summary: Gets the site display name.
description: Retrieves the site display name, which is the name
entered in the **Website Settings** section of a site's [dashboard](https://support.wix.com/en/article/about-your-wix-dashboard).

ret.doc: An object that contains information about a site's pages, prefixes, and lightboxes.

docs.summary: Returns information about a site's pages, prefixes, and lightboxes.
description: The returned `SiteStructure` object is a flattened representation of a site.
The structure doesn't include the headers and links from a site's **Pages** menu.

examples.title: Get information about a site's pages, prefixes, and lightboxes

extra.description:
This example gets the structure of the site with the following in its pages menu:
 ![Site Structure](images/site_structure.png "Site Structure")

params.name: options
params.doc: The options used when getting the HTML element.

ret.doc: Fulfilled - HTML element containing site's theme CSS.

docs.summary:
Gets the CSS code of the site's theme.
Use `getSiteThemeHtml()` to get an HTML element containing the CSS code of a site's 
[theme colors and fonts](https://support.wix.com/en/article/wix-editor-customizing-your-sites-theme-and-design). 
Use `getSiteThemeHtml()` when embedding a custom element in a Wix site where the page's stylesheet 
is inaccessible, such as when using a shadow root or an internal iframe.

params.name: prefetchItems
params.doc: The items within the site to prefetch resources for.

docs.summary: Optimizes resource fetching of pages and lightboxes in a site so they'll load faster.
description: Use the `prefetchPageResources()` method to optimize resource fetching of pages and
lightboxes a site's visitors are likely to visit next. When a site
visitor navigates to those pages or lightboxes, they'll load quicker than usual
since some of their resources have already been retrieved.
You can only prefetch resources from pages or lightboxes within the current site.
A prefetch is considered successful if the specified pages and lightboxes exist in
the current site. If any of the specified pages or lightboxes do not exist, the
prefetch operation returns an error status and lists of the pages and lightboxes
that were not found.

params.name: routerPrefix
params.doc: The prefix of the router to get the sitemap for.

ret.doc:
Fulfilled - A list of sitemap entries.
Rejected - The error that caused the rejection.

docs.summary: Returns the sitemap for a router or dynamic page prefix.
description: The `routerSitemap()` method returns a Promise that resolves to a list of
`WixSitemapEntry` objects. Each
`WixSitemapEntry` includes
information about a page, such as its URL, title, and name.
A sitemap is used by search engines to find the links to the site's pages.

examples.title: Get the sitemap for a prefix

docs.summary:
An object that contains information about which pages and lightboxes to
 prefetch resources for.

members.name: pages
members.doc:
The relative or absolute URLs of the pages in a site
 to prefetch resources for.

members.name: lightboxes
members.doc:
The names of the lightboxes in a site to prefetch 
 resources for.

 > **Note:** Pages are listed by relative or absolute URL, but lightboxes are listed by name. 
 See `location.to` to learn how to find a page's relative 
 URL. You can find a lightbox's name by selecting the lightbox and clicking the settings button.

docs.summary: An object that's returned from a prefetch request.

members.name: message
members.doc: A success or failure message.

members.name: errors
members.doc: The errors that occurred.

docs.summary: An object that's returned when a resource prefetch is unsuccessful.

members.name: pages
members.doc: The names of the pages for which prefetch failed.

members.name: lightboxes
members.doc: The names of the lightbox for which prefetch failed.

docs.summary: An object that contains information about a site's prefixes.

examples.title: Get information about a site's prefixes

extra.description:
This example gets the prefixes of a site with the following in its pages menu:
 ![Site Structure](images/site_structure.png "Site Structure")

members.name: name
members.doc: The name of the prefix.

members.name: type
members.doc:
The type of the prefix.
 
 A site's routers, dynamic pages, and app pages all have prefixes.

 One of: 

 + `"dynamicPages"`
 + `"router"`
 + `"app"`

members.name: prefix
members.doc: The prefix.

members.name: applicationId
members.doc: If the prefix is an app's prefix, the `applicationId` property is the app's ID.

docs.summary: An object that contains information about a site's pages, prefixes, and lightboxes.

examples.title: Get information about a site's pages, prefixes, and lightboxes

extra.description:
This example gets the structure of a site with the following in its pages menu:
 ![Site Structure](images/site_structure.png "Site Structure")

members.name: pages
members.doc:
The pages of a site.
 Pages can be regular pages, dynamic pages, router pages, or pages from an app.

members.name: prefixes
members.doc: The prefixes of the site's routers and dynamic pages.

members.name: lightboxes
members.doc: The site's lightboxes.

docs.summary: An object that contains information about a lightbox on a site.

examples.title: Get information about the current lightbox
Get information about a site's lightboxes

extra.description:
This example gets the lightboxes of the site with the following in its pages menu:
 ![Site Structure](images/site_structure.png "Site Structure")

members.name: name
members.doc: The name of the lightbox.

docs.summary: An object that contains information about a page on a site.

examples.title: Get information about the current page
Get information about the site's pages

extra.description:
This example gets the pages of a site with the following in its pages menu:
 ![Site Structure](images/site_structure.png "Site Structure")

members.name: name
members.doc: Page name.

members.name: type
members.doc: Page type: `"static"` or `"template"`.

members.name: url
members.doc: URL of the page. If the page is a `static` page the `url` property is the page's SEO URL.

members.name: applicationId
members.doc: If the page is an app page, the `applicationId` property is the app's ID.

members.name: prefix
members.doc: If the page is a router or dynamic page, the `prefix` property is the page's prefix.

members.name: isHomePage
members.doc: If the page is the Home page, `isHomePage` is `true`. Otherwise, it doesn't exist.

docs.summary: The options used when getting the HTML element.

members.name: testId
members.doc: An identifier that's added in a `data-test-id` attribute on the returned HTML element. Use this identifier to locate the HTML element when testing your code.

docs.summary: The options used when getting an HTML element.

members.name: testId
members.doc: An identifier that's added in a `data-test-id` attribute on the returned HTML element. You can use this identifier to locate the HTML element when testing your code.
